issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: CloudFormation: stack's template not written to DB

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Creating Security Group with Cloudformation Fails for non-admin User

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

While verifying EUCA-10231, created a cloudformation stack using the following template:
{code}
{

    "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09",

    "Description" : "Cloudformation Example => Run instance with userdata in security group",

    "Parameters": {
        "UbuntuImageId": {
            "Description":"Ubuntu Image id",
            "Type":"String",
            "NoEcho":"False"
        },

        "UserKeyPair": {
            "Description":"User Key Pair",
            "Type":"String",
            "NoEcho":"False"
        }
    },

    "Resources" : {

        "DockerInstance": {
            "Type": "AWS::EC2::Instance",
                "Properties": {
                    "ImageId" : { "Ref":"UbuntuImageId" },
                    "InstanceType" : "m1.large",
                    "UserData" : { "Fn::Base64" : "#include https://get.docker.io" },
                    "KeyName" : { "Ref" : "UserKeyPair" }
            }
        }
    },

    "Outputs" : {
        "InstanceId" : {
            "Description" : "InstanceId of the newly created EC2 instance",
            "Value" : { "Ref" : "DockerInstance" }
        },
        "AZ" : {
            "Description" : "Availability Zone of the newly created EC2 instance",
            "Value" : { "Fn::GetAtt" : [ "DockerInstance", "AvailabilityZone" ] }
        },
        "PublicIP" : {
            "Description" : "Public IP address of the newly created EC2 instance",
            "Value" : { "Fn::GetAtt" : [ "DockerInstance", "PublicIp" ] }
        }
    }
}
{code}
This template uses no security group (due to issue discovered in EUCA-10257).  After creating the stack, the following was reported back:
{code}
# euform-describe-stacks --region tessai-group1@group1
STACK	DockerStack	ROLLBACK_FAILED	The following resource(s) failed to delete: [DockerInstance].	Cloudformation Example => Run instance with userdata in security group	2014-12-19T20:47:07.432Z
{code}
However, if the user describe the running instances, the following was returned:
{code}
# euca-describe-instances --region tessai-group1@group1
RESERVATION	r-15e88a36	617513010345	default
INSTANCE	i-acbf0bb8	emi-c883ed00	euca-10-111-52-49.eucalyptus.h-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-52-176.eucalyptus.internal	running	tessai	0		m1.large	2014-12-19T20:47:10.236Z	one				monitoring-disabled	10.111.52.49	10.111.52.176			instance-store					hvm			sg-b9bf658a				x86_64
{code}

*Signs*

* Full stack events:
{code}
# euform-describe-stack-events DockerStack --region admin-hspencer@group1
EVENT	DockerStack	17f42c49-0584-4e51-b6d4-5767b7e9e7b5	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	DockerStack	arn:aws:cloudformation::617513010345:stack/DockerStack/fa2f52cd-aaba-43e6-b1ab-10a950e66192	2014-12-19T20:48:29.109Z	ROLLBACK_FAILED	The following resource(s) failed to delete: [DockerInstance].
EVENT	DockerStack	DockerInstance-DELETE_FAILED-1419022108111	AWS::EC2::Instance	DockerInstance	i-acbf0bb8	2014-12-19T20:48:28.111Z	DELETE_FAILED	You are not authorized to perform this operation.
EVENT	DockerStack	DockerInstance-DELETE_IN_PROGRESS-1419022106932	AWS::EC2::Instance	DockerInstance	i-acbf0bb8	2014-12-19T20:48:26.932Z	DELETE_IN_PROGRESS
EVENT	DockerStack	9e75dbfe-ce23-4740-99a3-14db0b07f75e	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	DockerStack	arn:aws:cloudformation::617513010345:stack/DockerStack/fa2f52cd-aaba-43e6-b1ab-10a950e66192	2014-12-19T20:48:26.100Z	ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS	Create stack failed.  Rollback requested by user.
EVENT	DockerStack	ee238dcb-ec49-4914-86e1-423473a94bdc	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	DockerStack	arn:aws:cloudformation::617513010345:stack/DockerStack/fa2f52cd-aaba-43e6-b1ab-10a950e66192	2014-12-19T20:48:07.399Z	CREATE_FAILED	The following resource(s) failed to create: [DockerInstance].
EVENT	DockerStack	DockerInstance-CREATE_FAILED-1419022086316	AWS::EC2::Instance	DockerInstance	i-acbf0bb8	2014-12-19T20:48:06.316Z	CREATE_FAILED	You are not authorized to perform this operation.
EVENT	DockerStack	DockerInstance-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1419022085723	AWS::EC2::Instance	DockerInstance	i-acbf0bb8	2014-12-19T20:48:05.723Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS
EVENT	DockerStack	DockerInstance-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1419022030300	AWS::EC2::Instance	DockerInstance	i-acbf0bb8	2014-12-19T20:47:10.300Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS
EVENT	DockerStack	DockerInstance-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1419022028581	AWS::EC2::Instance	DockerInstance		2014-12-19T20:47:08.581Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS
EVENT	DockerStack	183fc216-6227-42fe-9d96-0bc6f655751c	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	DockerStack	arn:aws:cloudformation::617513010345:stack/DockerStack/fa2f52cd-aaba-43e6-b1ab-10a950e66192	2014-12-19T20:47:07.798Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated
{code}

If you would like to use Docker as a non-root user, you should now consider
adding your user to the "docker" group with something like:

  sudo usermod -aG docker your-user

Remember that you will have to log out and back in for this to take effect!

fields.summary: Creating Instance with non-admin user with Cloudformation reports failure, however instance launches successfully

comments.body: [~hspencer], please try adding permission for the user to create tags (ec2:CreateTags)

[~sjones],

Yep, works just fine.  Looks like its a similar issue seen in EUCA-10257 where 'ec2:CreateTags' needs to be added when tagging resources isn't being used in the cloudformation template.

This failed due to tagging failing after the instance was launched.  User does not have permission to create tags.  The fix allows the non-admin user to run create instance with EC2:RunInstances and EC2:DescribeInstances.  EC2:CreateTags is only necessary if --tag is used in the create-stack call, or there are "Tag" properties in the instance definition.

I am able to start an instance with a non-admin user and no EC2:CreateTags permission defined in the user policy 
{code}
[b-16:~/mike]euform-create-stack -p KeyName=mike -p ImageId=emi-af2ec552 --template-file  instance.json t1
arn:aws:cloudformation::408908251600:stack/t1/8ac73dc9-dd26-46f5-b10d-2ffd38b8207e
[b-16:~/mike]euform-describe-stacks
STACK	t1	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated			2015-01-17T00:12:39.797Z
[b-16:~/mike]euform-describe-stacks
STACK	t1	CREATE_COMPLETE	Complete!			2015-01-17T00:12:39.797Z
{code}
